ProjectTitle: Unraveling the in vivo host cell tropism and virus dissemination strategies of human norovirus.
InitialFeedbackHistory:
21/06/2022
4. Metadata
Maybe check whether these Flow Cytometry Standards recommended by the  International Society for Advancement of Cytometry  are relevant to use: https://isac-net.org/page/Data-Standards
And for microscopy, standards such as the Open Microscopy Environment Ontology (https://fairsharing.org/bsg-s001430/) and the Cellular Microscopy Phenotype Ontology (CMPO) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/cmpo/) can help provide standardised metadata terms.
6. Preservation
Do samples (larvae, virus) need to be preserved? If yes, then indicate where.
7. Data sharing
For your kind of data there are better discipline-specific repositories (instead of RDR), e.g. ArrayExpress, BioImage Archive. Have a look here: https://elixir-europe.org/platforms/data/elixir-deposition-databases and https://www.ebi.ac.uk/bioimage-archive/
label: good with suggestions
